intro: Thalictrum pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean meadow-rue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southwestern Europe. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators like bees and flies. Thalictrum pyrenaicum is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
